conclusion: Analyze the process of a Stirling cycle in a P-V diagram.
Identify the process: Stirling cycle involves expansion and compression of a gas from A to B, C, D, and back to A.
Understand the nature of the process: Isothermal process means constant temperature, volume changes while pressure changes.
In an isothermal process, the number of molecules colliding with the wall per unit area per unit time remains constant.
Since the number of molecules colliding with the wall per unit area per unit time is constant in an isothermal process, it's the same at state C and state D.
Conclude: The number of molecules colliding with the wall per unit area per unit time is constant from state C to state D.
